title: Accelerating AI Program
description: VentureLAB's Accelerating AI program supports early-stage AI companies based in Ontario to develop, validate, and commercialize their deep-tech products and services globally. Participants gain access to up to $10,000 in non-dilutive funding, expert mentorship, and a network of partners and investors.
geography_details: Companies must be based in Ontario.
sdg_alignment: ['8: Decent Work and Economic Growth', '9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure']
notes: Applications for Cohort 1 are closed. Information for Cohort 2 will be released soon.
application_docs_raw: Details regarding required application documents are typically provided within the application portal itself.
application_questions_text: Specific application questions are typically found within the application form or portal once applications open.

title: The Voucher for Innovation and Productivity (VIP)
description: The Voucher for Innovation and Productivity (VIP) program helps companies develop, implement and commercialize new technologies, products and processes. By fostering collaboration between companies and publicly-funded post-secondary institutions, VIP supports the advancement of game-changing innovations.
supported_project_types: ['Research and Development', 'Technology Commercialization', 'Process Innovation', 'Product Innovation', 'Prototype Development']
sdg_alignment: ['Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure (SDG 9)', 'Decent Work and Economic Growth (SDG 8)']
notes: Requires partnership with an Ontario-based publicly-funded post-secondary institution. Companies must match the OCI contribution with cash and in-kind contributions.
application_docs_raw: Requires a project proposal including project activities, budget, outcomes, and partnership details with a post-secondary institution. Contact an OCI Business Development Manager to initiate an application.
application_questions_text: Project objectives, proposed activities, expected outcomes, budget breakdown, details of the academic partnership, company background and financial capacity.

title: Critical Technologies Initiative
description: TIAP's Critical Technologies Initiative provides seed funding and strategic support to accelerate the commercialization of promising early-stage critical technologies originating from TIAP's member institutions. The initiative focuses on innovations with significant economic and social impact, particularly within the life sciences and healthcare sectors, aiming to bridge funding gaps and de-risk early-stage development.
geography_details: Focused on member institutions: University of Toronto, its affiliated hospitals, OCAD University, and Scarborough Health Network. Applicants should be based in Toronto/Ontario.
sdg_alignment: ['SDG 3: Good Health and Well-being', 'SDG 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure', 'SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals']
notes: Expression of Interest (EOI) submissions are accepted on a rolling basis and should be sent via email to critical.technologies@tiap.ca.
application_docs_raw: Expression of Interest (EOI) including a non-confidential project summary, commercialization plan, budget and team information.
application_questions_text: Project summary, commercialization plan, budget, team information.

title: Alberta Innovates Funding Programs Overview
description: Alberta Innovates offers a broad range of funding opportunities to Alberta-based researchers and companies, helping to drive innovation across diverse sectors. Programs support everything from early-stage research to product development, commercialization, and scale-up, focusing on areas like health, clean resources, food & agriculture, and emerging technologies.
geography_details: Applicants must be based in Alberta.
sdg_alignment: ['SDG 2: Zero Hunger', 'SDG 3: Good Health and Well-being', 'SDG 6: Clean Water and Sanitation', 'SDG 7: Affordable and Clean Energy', 'SDG 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure', 'SDG 12: Responsible Consumption and Production', 'SDG 13: Climate Action', 'SDG 15: Life on Land']
notes: This entry summarizes the general funding landscape of Alberta Innovates as presented on their main funding overview page. Specific details for individual programs (e.g., exact amounts, deadlines, application documents) are not available directly on this page and require navigating to specific program pages.
